nodes.title:
"An investor who invested $100 in the S&P 500 in 1960 and held onto their investment would now have $43,132. 

An investor who employed a BTD strategy of buying in 1960, selling at new ATHs and waiting for a
10% correction before buying back have a portfolio worth just $534." https://t.co/3c3pM3SWfH
